question.text:
Monocot plants are characterized by the presence of how many of the following characters?

Scutellum, Reticulate venation, Fibrous roots, Stilt roots, Pulvinous leaf base, Isobilateral leaves

solution.text: Monocot plants are group of Angiosperms that have a single cotyledon in their seed. These plants have a fibrous root system (adventitious) which develop from the plumule. The leaves have parallel venation with stomata on both surfaces and vascular bundles are both - small and large. The leaves are isobilateral as both surfaces appear similar. The cotyledon of monocots are generally referred to as scutellum as they are thin and shield shape.
